description:
At Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as a tech startup within a Fortune 100 company, we are leading a digital disruption that will redefine how people experience insurance.
 Architecture Enablement Team within Liberty Mutual Global Retail Markets - US is actively searching for a Software Engineer to join their team! This team provides architectural leadership, support and enablement of modern, cloud-native software development. Implementing and influencing a platform based on the latest tools, principles, patterns and practices of cloud-native engineering. This team builds capabilities that allow the organization focus on rapid delivery of business value. Our platform provides mission critical engineering enablement to our application teams, allowing them to create and instantly deploy new applications while taking advantage of open source enterprise-class capabilities.
 Most importantly, you'll be engaged in meaningful work in an organization that is committed to 'helping people live safer, more secure lives' every day.
 Responsibilities:
 - Create tools, patterns, practices, and a cloud-native platform that allow teams to focus on delivering business value rapidly
 - Analyze technical system problems, design and implement effective solutions
 - Handle end-to-end development, including coding, testing, and debugging during each cycle
 - Support feature technical implementation
 - Create and maintain technical documentation
 - Executes all levels of testing (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)
 - Research technology and bring new ideas to the team
 - Possess a deep understanding of the product and business goals which you can translate into technology decisions
 - Keeps informed of advances in IT and Agile Engineering practices
 - Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferred.
 - 2+ years of professional development experience in a major development language (JavaScript) with emphasis on back-end services including experience with using AWS, server-side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST) including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
 - Familiarity with CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Git, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo
 - You know how to write readable, maintainable, and performant code
 - You have a deep knowledge of software engineering best practices
 - You have a great ability to learn, and you are eager to expand your areas of expertise
 - You have experience working hands-on as a Software Engineer in an agile environment
 - You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
 - You have experience in identifying, debugging and resolving complex production issues
 - Familiarity with application monitoring tools such as Splunk, - DataDog and AppDynamics(desired)
 - Experience with Cloud Technologies such as AWS and Cloud Foundry (desired)
 - Experience with container technologies such as Docker or Pivotal Cloud Foundry (desired)
 At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
 Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
 We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
 Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

JOB TITLE: Firmware Software Engineer 
LOCATION: Redmond, WA (onsite) 
DURATION: 12+ Months 
PAY RANGE: $80-85/hr. W2 
Job Description: Onsite 
Summary: 
The Sensors Team is looking for an experienced firmware engineer to work on developing firmware for customized image sensors. You will be working together with image sensor engineers, electrical engineers, etc. on building and testing prototypes. 
Job Responsibilities: 
- Develop firmware to integrate customized image sensors into prototyping systems 
- Testing the developed firmware with the hardware 
- Support debugging issues reported by users of the prototypes 
- Minimum qualifications: 
- 5+ years of experience with firmware development in C/C++ language 
- 5+ years of experience with developing firmware to control image sensors or cameras 
- Familiar with hardware testing equipment including oscilloscope, function generator, power supply etc. 
- Experience with Zephyr OS 
- Experience with I2C/I3C 
- Experience with MIPI C/D-PHY 
- Preferred Qualifications:  
- Experience with Python for image sensor data analysis 
- Experience with GUI design  
- Education/Experience:  
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or relevant field required. 
IND123

IND123

Job Description:
Leidos currently has an opening for an Autonomous Systems Embedded Software Engineer to support the development and integration of Underwater Vehicle programs that address existing and emerging maritime missions of national importance for a broad range of customers across multiple Department of Defense agencies. This position is located at either the Lynnwood or Poulsbo, WA office.
- Primary Responsibilities
-Support software development efforts for multiple projects
- Assist in streamlining software tooling and processes on the team
- Aid in troubleshooting software defects and perform root-cause analysis
- Provide system administration and infrastructure management of software development environments
- Support for basic code writing in C++, Python, or a similar language
- Support for software test events as a test operator and support engineer
- Basic Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree with 0-2 years of relevant experience
- Eligibility to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance
- Basic language skills in C/C++
- A desire to learn and grow technically in a variety of areas
- Experience and background with troubleshooting software issues
- Ability to communicate and share ideas, concepts, designs, and technical plans with other engineers
- An eagerness to solve complex problems and work together with both junior and senior-level developers to achieve project goals
- Constant integrity in working with our employees and customers
- Preferred Qualifications
- Exposure to languages such as C#, Java, Python, Rust, and others
- Experience with Agile-based methodologies using t
- Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket) or similar tools
- Experience with Linux and Windows systems
- Experience with virtualized development and production environments (VMware)
- Pay Range:
- Pay Range $53,300.00 - $82,000.00 - $110,700.00
- The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Role – Software Design Engineer 3 Location – Redmond, WA / Hybrid
 Duration - 6/30/23 – Possible extension
 Job Description:
 The Azure Performance Engineering team works on the performance of core Azure components and services. We work on the top Azure scenarios and are responsible for understanding performance end-to-end and helping industry analysts and customers achieve the best possible performance on Azure and working with teams to help them implement performance testing, verify their performance, and track their progress toward signoff.
 We are looking for a hands-on engineer to work on migrating existing tests and support systems away from existing test systems to new systems, and to standardize test design and implementation where possible. This includes enhancing existing support systems, databases, and probably building a new website for hosting team information, reports, dashboards, and other content we’ve already built (and that related to the updated tests).
 Performance tests and support systems are built with C# and PowerShell (Windows) and Bash, C#, and PowerShell (Linux) and run in the Azure cloud (sometimes also in AWS, Google, or other clouds) using a variety of (mostly internally built) test systems. Results and telemetry are transmitted using Azure Event Hub, Azure Storage, and other Azure services. Reports are built using Azure Data Explorer (aka Kusto) queries and tools within a custom framework to produce reports using a combination of Excel, MarkDown, and HTML (with additional polishing using PowerPoint and Word as appropriate). Status is tracked using a combination of Azure Dev Ops (ADO) and custom tracking systems. Some dashboards have been built using Power BI; however, we’re incorporating other technologies where appropriate. 
 Job qualifications:
 The ideal candidate combines a strong work ethic, ability to understand and work on complex systems, and passion for performance analysis and improvement. 
Excellent software design and C# implementation skills. Office Integration, PowerShell, and Bash experience a strong plus.
 Strong knowledge of data modeling and data driven systems design, algorithms and data structures.
 Strong understanding of database design, data flows, queries, and data manipulation.
 At least 3 years of experience with performance workload implementation, automation and data analysis.
 Experience with performance analysis tools on Linux or Windows a plus.
 Machine learning and data science experience a plus.
 Excellent writing and communication skills.
 A bachelor’s or higher degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience.
 Job responsibilities:
 Port test content and automation from existing systems to support newer systems and improve automation, tracking, and reporting
 Track and fix test, test system, and reporting issues
 Author first draft of reports on performance issues
 Enhance and extend systems as appropriate
 Learn how existing tests and systems work to support (a) writing better reports, and (b) fixing and enhancing existing tests or implementing new tests and workloads.
 Help prepare regular reports on Azure or competitor performance, identify opportunities for automation or other improvements, and implement those improvements as appropriate.
 Building dashboards using agreed tools
 Prepare and execute performance test plans (leveraging existing tests and tools) as necessary to support ongoing test needs
 Update supporting data and meta data files as needed (typically as needed semi-automated processes), fix and enhance tools when needed.
 Automating data flow and caching, updating queries to reference new data sources. 
 Fix and enhance existing tests or implement new tests and workloads as requested.
  Typical task breakdown:
 - 15-20% meetings, some days can be heavier or lighter, more meetings will be scheduled
 - 50% coding
 - 15-20% testing
 - 15-20% reviews & documentation – the role will have a DevOps component, but t
 - Operations component will be small
 Top 3 Skills:
 1. C#, PowerShell, and Bash experience | 4-5+ years at least
 2. Database experience (SQL, Kusto) | 3-5+
 3. Performance workload implementation | 3-5+

 Most importantly, you'll be engaged in meaningful work in an organization that is committed to 'helping people live safer, more secure lives' every day.
 Responsibilities:
 - Create tools, patterns, practices, and a cloud-native platform that allow teams to focus on delivering business value rapidly
 - Analyze technical system problems, design and implement effective solutions
 - Handle end-to-end development, including coding, testing, and debugging during each cycle
 - Support feature technical implementation
 - Create and maintain technical documentation
 - Executes all levels of testing (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)
 - Research technology and bring new ideas to the team
 - Possess a deep understanding of the product and business goals which you can translate into technology decisions
 - Keeps informed of advances in IT and Agile Engineering practices
 - Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferred.
 - 2+ years of professional development experience in a major development language (JavaScript) with emphasis on back-end services including experience with using AWS, server-side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST) including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
 - Familiarity with CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Git, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo
 - You know how to write readable, maintainable, and performant code
 - You have a deep knowledge of software engineering best practices
 - You have a great ability to learn, and you are eager to expand your areas of expertise
 - You have experience working hands-on as a Software Engineer in an agile environment
 - You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
 - You have experience in identifying, debugging and resolving complex production issues
 - Familiarity with application monitoring tools such as Splunk, - DataDog and AppDynamics(desired)
 - Experience with Cloud Technologies such as AWS and Cloud Foundry (desired)
 - Experience with container technologies such as Docker or Pivotal Cloud Foundry (desired)

JOB TITLE: Firmware Software Engineer 
LOCATION: Redmond, WA (onsite) 
DURATION: 12+ Months 
PAY RANGE: $80-85/hr. W2 
Job Description: Onsite 
Summary: 
The Sensors Team is looking for an experienced firmware engineer to work on developing firmware for customized image sensors. You will be working together with image sensor engineers, electrical engineers, etc. on building and testing prototypes. 
Job Responsibilities: 
- Develop firmware to integrate customized image sensors into prototyping systems 
- Testing the developed firmware with the hardware 
- Support debugging issues reported by users of the prototypes 
- Minimum qualifications: 
- 5+ years of experience with firmware development in C/C++ language 
- 5+ years of experience with developing firmware to control image sensors or cameras 
- Familiar with hardware testing equipment including oscilloscope, function generator, power supply etc. 
- Experience with Zephyr OS 
- Experience with I2C/I3C 
- Experience with MIPI C/D-PHY 
- Preferred Qualifications:  
- Experience with Python for image sensor data analysis 
- Experience with GUI design  
- Education/Experience:  
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or relevant field required. 
IND123

Job Description:
Leidos currently has an opening for an Autonomous Systems Embedded Software Engineer to support the development and integration of Underwater Vehicle programs that address existing and emerging maritime missions of national importance for a broad range of customers across multiple Department of Defense agencies. This position is located at either the Lynnwood or Poulsbo, WA office.
- Primary Responsibilities
-Support software development efforts for multiple projects
- Assist in streamlining software tooling and processes on the team
- Aid in troubleshooting software defects and perform root-cause analysis
- Provide system administration and infrastructure management of software development environments
- Support for basic code writing in C++, Python, or a similar language
- Support for software test events as a test operator and support engineer
- Basic Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree with 0-2 years of relevant experience
- Eligibility to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance
- Basic language skills in C/C++
- A desire to learn and grow technically in a variety of areas
- Experience and background with troubleshooting software issues
- Ability to communicate and share ideas, concepts, designs, and technical plans with other engineers
- An eagerness to solve complex problems and work together with both junior and senior-level developers to achieve project goals
- Constant integrity in working with our employees and customers
- Preferred Qualifications
- Exposure to languages such as C#, Java, Python, Rust, and others
- Experience with Agile-based methodologies using t
- Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket) or similar tools
- Experience with Linux and Windows systems
- Experience with virtualized development and production environments (VMware)
- Pay Range:
- Pay Range $53,300.00 - $82,000.00 - $110,700.00
- The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Role – Software Design Engineer 3 Location – Redmond, WA / Hybrid
 Duration - 6/30/23 – Possible extension
 Job Description:
 The Azure Performance Engineering team works on the performance of core Azure components and services. We work on the top Azure scenarios and are responsible for understanding performance end-to-end and helping industry analysts and customers achieve the best possible performance on Azure and working with teams to help them implement performance testing, verify their performance, and track their progress toward signoff.
 We are looking for a hands-on engineer to work on migrating existing tests and support systems away from existing test systems to new systems, and to standardize test design and implementation where possible. This includes enhancing existing support systems, databases, and probably building a new website for hosting team information, reports, dashboards, and other content we’ve already built (and that related to the updated tests).
 Performance tests and support systems are built with C# and PowerShell (Windows) and Bash, C#, and PowerShell (Linux) and run in the Azure cloud (sometimes also in AWS, Google, or other clouds) using a variety of (mostly internally built) test systems. Results and telemetry are transmitted using Azure Event Hub, Azure Storage, and other Azure services. Reports are built using Azure Data Explorer (aka Kusto) queries and tools within a custom framework to produce reports using a combination of Excel, MarkDown, and HTML (with additional polishing using PowerPoint and Word as appropriate). Status is tracked using a combination of Azure Dev Ops (ADO) and custom tracking systems. Some dashboards have been built using Power BI; however, we’re incorporating other technologies where appropriate. 
 Job qualifications:
 The ideal candidate combines a strong work ethic, ability to understand and work on complex systems, and passion for performance analysis and improvement. 
Excellent software design and C# implementation skills. Office Integration, PowerShell, and Bash experience a strong plus.
 Strong knowledge of data modeling and data driven systems design, algorithms and data structures.
 Strong understanding of database design, data flows, queries, and data manipulation.
 At least 3 years of experience with performance workload implementation, automation and data analysis.
 Experience with performance analysis tools on Linux or Windows a plus.
 Machine learning and data science experience a plus.
 Excellent writing and communication skills.
 A bachelor’s or higher degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience.
 Job responsibilities:
 Port test content and automation from existing systems to support newer systems and improve automation, tracking, and reporting
 Track and fix test, test system, and reporting issues
 Author first draft of reports on performance issues
 Enhance and extend systems as appropriate
 Learn how existing tests and systems work to support (a) writing better reports, and (b) fixing and enhancing existing tests or implementing new tests and workloads.
 Help prepare regular reports on Azure or competitor performance, identify opportunities for automation or other improvements, and implement those improvements as appropriate.
 Building dashboards using agreed tools
 Prepare and execute performance test plans (leveraging existing tests and tools) as necessary to support ongoing test needs
 Update supporting data and meta data files as needed (typically as needed semi-automated processes), fix and enhance tools when needed.
 Automating data flow and caching, updating queries to reference new data sources. 
 Fix and enhance existing tests or implement new tests and workloads as requested.
  Typical task breakdown:
 - 15-20% meetings, some days can be heavier or lighter, more meetings will be scheduled
 - 50% coding
 - 15-20% testing
 - 15-20% reviews & documentation – the role will have a DevOps component, but t
 - Operations component will be small
 Top 3 Skills:
 1. C#, PowerShell, and Bash experience | 4-5+ years at least
 2. Database experience (SQL, Kusto) | 3-5+
 3. Performance workload implementation | 3-5+

This team builds capabilities that allow the organization focus on rapid delivery of business value.  - Analyze technical system problems, design and implement effective solutions

 - Create and maintain technical documentation
 - Executes all levels of testing (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)
 - Research technology and bring new ideas to the team
 - Possess a deep understanding of the product and business goals which you can translate into technology decisions
 - Keeps informed of advances in IT and Agile Engineering practices
 - Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferred.
 - 2+ years of professional development experience in a major development language (JavaScript) with emphasis on back-end services including experience with using AWS, server-side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST) including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
 - Familiarity with CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Git, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo
 - You know how to write readable, maintainable, and performant code
 - You have a deep knowledge of software engineering best practices
 - You have a great ability to learn, and you are eager to expand your areas of expertise
 - You have experience working hands-on as a Software Engineer in an agile environment
 - You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
 - You have experience in identifying, debugging and resolving complex production issues
 - Familiarity with application monitoring tools such as Splunk, - DataDog and AppDynamics(desired)
 - Experience with Cloud Technologies such as AWS and Cloud Foundry (desired)
 - Experience with container technologies such as Docker or Pivotal Cloud Foundry (desired)

- Pay Range $53,300.00 - $82,000.00 - $110,700.00
- The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Role – Software Design Engineer 3 Location – Redmond, WA / Hybrid
 Duration - 6/30/23 – Possible extension
 Job Description:
 The Azure Performance Engineering team works on the performance of core Azure components and services. We work on the top Azure scenarios and are responsible for understanding performance end-to-end and helping industry analysts and customers achieve the best possible performance on Azure and working with teams to help them implement performance testing, verify their performance, and track their progress toward signoff.
 We are looking for a hands-on engineer to work on migrating existing tests and support systems away from existing test systems to new systems, and to standardize test design and implementation where possible. This includes enhancing existing support systems, databases, and probably building a new website for hosting team information, reports, dashboards, and other content we’ve already built (and that related to the updated tests).
 Performance tests and support systems are built with C# and PowerShell (Windows) and Bash, C#, and PowerShell (Linux) and run in the Azure cloud (sometimes also in AWS, Google, or other clouds) using a variety of (mostly internally built) test systems. Results and telemetry are transmitted using Azure Event Hub, Azure Storage, and other Azure services. Reports are built using Azure Data Explorer (aka Kusto) queries and tools within a custom framework to produce reports using a combination of Excel, MarkDown, and HTML (with additional polishing using PowerPoint and Word as appropriate). Status is tracked using a combination of Azure Dev Ops (ADO) and custom tracking systems. Some dashboards have been built using Power BI; however, we’re incorporating other technologies where appropriate. 
 Job qualifications:
 The ideal candidate combines a strong work ethic, ability to understand and work on complex systems, and passion for performance analysis and improvement. 
Excellent software design and C# implementation skills. Office Integration, PowerShell, and Bash experience a strong plus.
 Strong knowledge of data modeling and data driven systems design, algorithms and data structures.
 Strong understanding of database design, data flows, queries, and data manipulation.
 At least 3 years of experience with performance workload implementation, automation and data analysis.
 Experience with performance analysis tools on Linux or Windows a plus.
 Machine learning and data science experience a plus.
 Excellent writing and communication skills.
 A bachelor’s or higher degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent experience.
 Job responsibilities:
 Port test content and automation from existing systems to support newer systems and improve automation, tracking, and reporting
 Track and fix test, test system, and reporting issues
 Author first draft of reports on performance issues
 Enhance and extend systems as appropriate
 Learn how existing tests and systems work to support (a) writing better reports, and (b) fixing and enhancing existing tests or implementing new tests and workloads.
 Help prepare regular reports on Azure or competitor performance, identify opportunities for automation or other improvements, and implement those improvements as appropriate.
 Building dashboards using agreed tools
 Prepare and execute performance test plans (leveraging existing tests and tools) as necessary to support ongoing test needs
 Update supporting data and meta data files as needed (typically as needed semi-automated processes), fix and enhance tools when needed.
 Automating data flow and caching, updating queries to reference new data sources. 
 Fix and enhance existing tests or implement new tests and workloads as requested.
  Typical task breakdown:
 - 15-20% meetings, some days can be heavier or lighter, more meetings will be scheduled
 - 50% coding
 - 15-20% testing
 - 15-20% reviews & documentation – the role will have a DevOps component, but t
 - Operations component will be small
 Top 3 Skills:
 1. C#, PowerShell, and Bash experience | 4-5+ years at least
 2. Database experience (SQL, Kusto) | 3-5+
 3. Performance workload implementation | 3-5+

JOB TITLE: Firmware Software Engineer 
LOCATION: Redmond, WA (onsite) 
DURATION: 12+ Months 
PAY RANGE: $80-85/hr. W2 
Job Description: Onsite 
Summary: 
The Sensors Team is looking for an experienced firmware engineer to work on developing firmware for customized image sensors. You will be working together with image sensor engineers, electrical engineers, etc. on building and testing prototypes. 
Job Responsibilities: 
- Develop firmware to integrate customized image sensors into prototyping systems 
- Testing the developed firmware with the hardware 
- Support debugging issues reported by users of the prototypes 
- Minimum qualifications: 
- 5+ years of experience with firmware development in C/C++ language 
- 5+ years of experience with developing firmware to control image sensors or cameras 
- Familiar with hardware testing equipment including oscilloscope, function generator, power supply etc. 
- Experience with Zephyr OS 
- Experience with I2C/I3C 
- Experience with MIPI C/D-PHY 
- Preferred Qualifications:  
- Experience with Python for image sensor data analysis 
- Experience with GUI design  
- Education/Experience:  
- Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering or relevant field required. 
IND123

Job Description:
Leidos currently has an opening for an Autonomous Systems Embedded Software Engineer to support the development and integration of Underwater Vehicle programs that address existing and emerging maritime missions of national importance for a broad range of customers across multiple Department of Defense agencies. This position is located at either the Lynnwood or Poulsbo, WA office.
- Primary Responsibilities
-Support software development efforts for multiple projects
- Assist in streamlining software tooling and processes on the team
- Aid in troubleshooting software defects and perform root-cause analysis
- Provide system administration and infrastructure management of software development environments
- Support for basic code writing in C++, Python, or a similar language
- Support for software test events as a test operator and support engineer
- Basic Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree with 0-2 years of relevant experience
- Eligibility to obtain and maintain a Secret clearance
- Basic language skills in C/C++
- A desire to learn and grow technically in a variety of areas
- Experience and background with troubleshooting software issues
- Ability to communicate and share ideas, concepts, designs, and technical plans with other engineers
- An eagerness to solve complex problems and work together with both junior and senior-level developers to achieve project goals
- Constant integrity in working with our employees and customers
- Preferred Qualifications
- Exposure to languages such as C#, Java, Python, Rust, and others
- Experience with Agile-based methodologies using t
- Atlassian tool suite (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket) or similar tools
- Experience with Linux and Windows systems
- Experience with virtualized development and production environments (VMware)
- Pay Range:
- Pay Range $53,300.00 - $82,000.00 - $110,700.00
- The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

At Liberty Mutual, technology isn't just a part of our business, it's what drives us forward. We deliver our customers peace of mind every day by helping them protect what they value most. Our passion for placing the customer at the center of everything we do is driving a transformational shift at Liberty Mutual. Operating as a tech startup within a Fortune 100 company, we are leading a digital disruption that will redefine how people experience insurance.
 Architecture Enablement Team within Liberty Mutual Global Retail Markets - US is actively searching for a Software Engineer to join their team! This team provides architectural leadership, support and enablement of modern, cloud-native software development. Implementing and influencing a platform based on the latest tools, principles, patterns and practices of cloud-native engineering. This team builds capabilities that allow the organization focus on rapid delivery of business value. Our platform provides mission critical engineering enablement to our application teams, allowing them to create and instantly deploy new applications while taking advantage of open source enterprise-class capabilities.
 Most importantly, you'll be engaged in meaningful work in an organization that is committed to 'helping people live safer, more secure lives' every day.
 Responsibilities:
 - Create tools, patterns, practices, and a cloud-native platform that allow teams to focus on delivering business value rapidly
 - Analyze technical system problems, design and implement effective solutions
 - Handle end-to-end development, including coding, testing, and debugging during each cycle
 - Support feature technical implementation
 - Create and maintain technical documentation
 - Executes all levels of testing (Unit, System, Integration, Regression)
 - Research technology and bring new ideas to the team
 - Possess a deep understanding of the product and business goals which you can translate into technology decisions
 - Keeps informed of advances in IT and Agile Engineering practices
 - Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experience, technical degree preferred.
 - 2+ years of professional development experience in a major development language (JavaScript) with emphasis on back-end services including experience with using AWS, server-side frameworks (preferably NodeJS) and managing APIs exposing microservices (REST) including development and support of Java/JavaScript services
 - Familiarity with CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Git, Gradle, Jenkins, Bamboo
 - You know how to write readable, maintainable, and performant code
 - You have a deep knowledge of software engineering best practices
 - You have a great ability to learn, and you are eager to expand your areas of expertise
 - You have experience working hands-on as a Software Engineer in an agile environment
 - You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code
 - You have experience in identifying, debugging and resolving complex production issues
 - Familiarity with application monitoring tools such as Splunk, - DataDog and AppDynamics(desired)
 - Experience with Cloud Technologies such as AWS and Cloud Foundry (desired)
 - Experience with container technologies such as Docker or Pivotal Cloud Foundry (desired)
 At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
 Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
 We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
 Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
